meanings.definition: To listen to sounds within the body, typically with a stethoscope.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will auscultate your chest to check for any irregular heartbeats.
meanings.sent2: During a check-up, the physician will auscultate your lungs to detect any signs of infection.
meanings.sent3: I tried to auscultate my stomach after a big meal, hoping to hear the digestion process.
meanings.sent4: She could auscultate the tension in the room just by listening to the silence.
meanings.sent5: The detective auscultated the suspect's heartbeat to see if it matched his alibi.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic will auscultate the engine to identify the source of the strange noise.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will auscultate the students' pronunciation during language lessons.
meanings.sent3: I decided to auscultate the plant to see if it needed more water by listening to its leaves.
meanings.sent4: She could auscultate the emotions in his voice as he spoke about his past.
meanings.sent5: The conductor auscultated the orchestra to ensure each instrument was in harmony.
